review:
ReviewBeen a fan of this car since it's launch in 15 and has been contemplating to change to it. Main reason not doing so is the same as many others. Old car loan still a big factor...

Finally the W212 is reaching it's 7th year and loan coming to an end. It's time to start looking for an SUV as the E class is starting to croak. And I am not young anymore as climbing in and out of a saloon is starting to strain my knees. 

Went for a few test drives among the SUV models and it all a fair fight between this car and the new X3...Would love to buy an MACAN, CAYENNE or even better the URUS. But realistically, my pockets is quite shallow.

 The X3 is quieter, more powerful and NEW.. With LED dashboard all in etc... The GLC200 facelift model will take some time before coming to our shores but it gives me a good sense of reliability, which is important to me as it will be driven by the missus. 

All in all, had a chat with my CFO and she gave the green light on the GLC200.. Thus will be waiting for it's delivery around July... Any longer I will have no car to drive cos Road tax and Insurance due in July...
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
What I likeReliability- my 4th Merc and they didn't give me much of an issue
Spacious- Definitely bigger than my E.. sans the boot
light footed- Light on the gas though its huge
last but not least, I've been eyeing to get once since...
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
What I do not likeLoud- Engine is slightly loud but I can live with that
Look- a bit dated but the new facelight model looks stunning
Time line- Though it's an old model, Delivery still have to wait for 3-4 months...
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
ReviewAfter viewing a few continental SUV, I finally settled for the GLC and bought it from C&C and was delivered to me in March'19. 
It seems like I've made a bad choice.
After 1 week my car stalled and had to be tow back to workshop. I was informed that the "Accelerator module" Was faulty and need to be replaced.
After 2 weeks out from the workshop, my car engine vibrate and engine warning signal showed up. Car was again towed back to workshop. 
Guess my expectation on MB reliability has dropped significantly.
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
ReviewTest drove this year end 2018. Took it out for the usual route. Car looks big but visibility is quite bad for rear view. Small windows decrease your visibility. 

Car is heavy for stability, cornering is good, and the inside looks up to date. Car hit legal speed limit without much pushing and it is a breeze to be the driver (the same cannot be said for rear passenger). 

OVerall, a good car to own, but at their price (was 230k thereabout), and with the new x3 launch at 220k and the ever reliability of lexus RX at 210k... Still a tough fight.
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
What I likeNew design (though there will be a FL in 2019), especially AMG kitted 
Coupe design is nice
Merc reliability 
Good noise insulation
A lot of PIs bringing in, so C&Cs has to do something on their selling price.
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
What I do not likePrice as compared to other competitors such as x3 or RX
Small rear, especially for tall passengers on 2nd row
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLC-Class Coupe F1 Auto Cars Edition(Parallel Imported)

review: ReviewPractical fun car . Drove it around with many mixed feelings. People tend not to give way to you as if you were to drive a bigger Mercedes models. Handling is excellent for singapore drives . Small and enough horsepower to handle singaporean style driving .
What I likeThe handling if you don't over step the accelerator. The "hi Mercedes " function to be able to call people without pressing the phone.
ReviewNot sure what segment GLA is targeting it's car on, but it's neither a full fledge SUV, nor it looks like a sedan externally, let's just call it a "A-Class with Steriods"

What I like- excellent attractive exterior design with it's curve and build
- in build with latest mercedes benz technology and features 
- if you looking for a somewhat sportier car outlook externally, and have a bigger budget than A class, GLA is your choice
- beauty on the road for the exterior curve and design
- great LED lighting
- fine performance when driving, nothing fancy

What I do not like- neither here nor there SUV for the size, as it is slightly bigger than A Class, however the spaciously is not deliberate built
- cannot really compare with BWM X series, as not sure if it make sense to benchmark X1, X3 etc ?
- quite confuse which target segment of customer GLA is reaching out to, somewhat if ML class stands out much better in this manner
- Not a high car considering it is SUV, more like a sedan height
- for the ~ $30k you pay to get GLA over A Class, I'd say it's not worth it as other than it's nice exterior and curves you are getting externally, the rest of the features are pretty much alike A, B class

ReviewVery impressive on its outlook, my fav is the dct gearbox with paddles. It drive like a manual transmission as it will do the engine brake.

The down side is that, there isn't any rear aircon. If there is a 122bhp it will be just nice, as it had fall into the cat b due to the bhp.
What I likethe gearbox

ReviewJust collected my white GLA180 end July 2019. I am loving it as it was the most sleek , nicely curved and elegant SUV i have owned so far. The promotional package by C&C was excellent and was fortunate enough to be served by a very professional and patient salesperson in MB. I like the fact that there are electric/memory seats to provide convenience for regular passengers, the interior furnishing is sufficiently posh and well designed with much thoughts put in from driver's and passengers' perspective. Performance of car was decent enough but more importantly, it is smooth and doesn't cause any sudden jerks for passengers which makes it a comfortable ride at all times. Boot space is smaller than my previous japanese car but sufficient enough for a small family's usage. All in all, i did not regret buying this car!

What I like-electric seats with memory
-smooth ride with decent insulation from outside
-higher commanding position compared to usual sedan
-passenger and driver's sporty seat
-ambience light in the car
-decent pickup of car even at lights
-easy adjustment of car boot door height
-service standards by C&C

What I do not like-no keyless option included
-no auto tailgate open with leg

ReviewTest drive the GLA 180 facelift version. Drive is comfort, handling is good and the car is responsive as well. The interior design and exterior styling of the face-lifted GLA are stunning. Interior is neat and exterior looks sporty and good. At the price range and the feature package , it should be one of the best and most valued for money car in the current market.

What I like+ Keyless Start
+ Driver and Passenger Electric Seats with Memory Function
+ Auto Tail Gate
+ Apple Car Play & Android Interface Ready
+ Excellent Interior & Exterior Quality
+ Made in Germany
+ Auto Hold Brake 
+ Safety Features
+ Nice Front Engine Grilles
+ Comfort Driver & Passenger Front Seats

What I do not like- No Keyless Entry
- No Kick Boot Opening

ReviewMy family owned this car for a year and I am lucky enough to take it for a spin occasionally. Here is my overdue review... 

car owned: E200 Exclusive

I was told the exclusive model comes with better leather trim and my family took this variant. 

Comfortable ride, generous seating space, especially 2nd row (I am 1.8M tall), quiet engine when cruising.

What I likeThe design
the brand and the comfort
better resale value 
good trade in price from C&Cs 
Service Credit and perks such as polishing, free drop off and pick up etc

What I do not likeC-Class/S-Class make no difference in design 
Some PHVs are using this model
Engine sound rough when push hard

ReviewMercedes is still the no. 1 German brand when it comes to comfort.  The car is roomy and practical with beautiful interior, including the cockpit and instruments, which are also very intuitive in operation.  Everything is always well in view and reachable; Even the windows hardly fog up when it rains.  The engine performs well with a top speed of over 230 km/h and a very good 80-120 km/h overtake factor for a four-cylinder base model.  The W212 (before the 2013 facelift) also has in my opinion the best exterior design of recent Mercedes E classes, before the headlights were integrated again and before the introduction of the "Diamond" Grille.

What I like- Interior design
- User interface
- Exterior design
- Practicability
- Comfort
- Perfection/detail

What I do not likeThe suspension is a bit too soft for going through high speed (wide) turns at over 200 km/h.  That's the price to pay for the driving comfort and probably not relevant unless driving on the German Autobahn.
ReviewDone huge changes in recent model. I love the interior fully digital panel, very good steering control. Easy to dribe. Only thing I miss is the sunroof..
ReviewDone huge changes in recent model. I love the interior fully digital panel, very good steering control. Easy to dribe. Only thing I miss is the sunroof..

ReviewTest drove the E-Class W213. For a big car, the controls were light and it was a comfortable drive. Exquisite cabin styling with practical features such as soft door close and kick boot opening. Ample leg and headroom in the back and a large 540L boot. 4 cylinder engine a little noisy on idle from outside but packs enough power for our SG roads. Didn't quite like the noise from run-flat tyres. Overall a very  elegant car to own.

ReviewTest drove the E200 avantgarde about a month ago.Not as spacious as expected. 9gtronic sounds something from NASA but its not.Nothing spectacular,to say the least about the car.Design looks dated.Interior too cliche.Typically,air con was not cold enough.Boring and simple drive.

What I like-front seats are very comfortable
-car is always ready to shoot once you floor it
-anti front collision system
-interior ambient lights though its just for cosmetics and serves no purpose
-good turning radius
-high ARF

What I do not like-start/stop feels like a lorry
-braking felt cheap
-shaky and hunting gearbox,especially at low speed
-jerky at times
-vibrates a lot during idling
-surprisingly,engine noise intrudes loudly.very loud
-upgrade needed for additional safety features
-probably will give me nightmares after warranty is over
-6 airbags.$70k KIA cerato is offering 7.

ReviewBefore I test drove the E200 Avantgarde, I was considering the Jaguar XE or XF. Test drove the Jaguar XF and E200 on the same day. I found the Jaguar XF a bit heavier in handling. Very surprisingly the E200 was quite light for a big car. The interior is simply mind-blowing. Good power from the 4-cylinder inline M274 turbo-charged engineand the new 9G-Tronic transmission was smooth. Good turning radius for a big car. The E200 also comes with many standard features which was extra on the Jag. Finally booked the E200 after having my wife test drive it as well. Reliability... Well only time will tell, but the torque delivery through the power train should be more than adequate for SG roads. Checked on safety such as European NCAP crash-test rating and this car is 5-star rated and also a good US IIHS rating. Safety features include brake assist and Pre-Safe, though blind spot assist came with an extra $2.1K. The car comes with Eco, Comfort, Sport and Sports plus modes. Some downsides, the run-flat tyres do create some undercarriage noise on the highway, but no wind noise. Other than that the cabin was pretty quiet. The rims could have been more sporty looking. Overall this is one car that has swayed my decision towards Merc... Finally!.

What I likeInterior and exterior styling. Safety features come as standard. Comfortable, light handing. Large 12.3 inch infotainment screen. Electric tailgate, electric seats with memory settings. Good room in the back seats. Large (540L) boot space.
What I do not likeRun-flat tyres causing rolling noise at higher speeds. Digital instrument display not included as standard.
ReviewNot sure what segment GLA is targeting it's car on, but it's neither a full fledge SUV, nor it looks like a sedan externally, let's just call it a "A-Class with Steriods"
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLA-Class Cars & Coffee Edition(Parallel Imported)

review: What I likethe gearbox
car_name: Mercedes-Benz GLA-Class Cars & Coffee Edition(Parallel Imported)

review:
ReviewMy review is with reference to the 318i M Sport that I also rented for a recent overseas trip. I had the C180 in Avantgarde trim for 6 days. It came with 9G tronic.
For whatever reason, the suspension was awful. It transmits everything on the road into the cabin, and has poor absorption of the bumps. The car does ok for low-speed bumps but it thumps uncomfortably on high-speed bumps. Road noise is also a big problem at speeds above 80km/h. The car was fitted with Bridgestone Turanza T001 run-flats and they are meant to be comfort tyres. Super noisy. The 318i M-Sport that i drove before the C180, came with 18" Wheels and was quieter and more comfortable than the C180. Shocking. The 9G-Tronic gearbox wasn't smooth at all. It shifts hardly into gears quite often, unlike the smooth gearbox in the 318i.
The C-Class has an off-set steering wheel, and the seats were very uncomfortable for long drives, lacking in lumber and thigh support. Poor ride, poor handling, poor refinement... In comparison to the 318i M-Sport. And you thought those should be all the negatives? Nope. The cabin may be nice, with nice choices of materials for the switches. But the gloss black center stack scratches easily and feels absolutely cheap. There was a constant rattling near the driver's side A-pillars even though there was only 20,000km on the car. The 3-series felt better built with better fit-and-finish. The boot has a wider opening than the 3-series so it is easier to fit your luggage through the opening. 
The C Class is supposed to be the most comfort-oriented car in the Compact Executive class, and it's premium pricing vs the rest raises expectations. I am putting this car right at the bottom of the class.

What I likeClassy exterior styling.
Classy interior styling.
Interior is slightly more spacious than a 3-Series

What I do not likeUgly iPad screen.
Difficult to use infotainment.
Difficult to use cruise-control stalk. Can get confused with signal stalk and cruise control stalk when operating on the fly.
Gearshift stalk is confusing and not intuitive to use.
Very intrusive road noise that produces a thrumming frequency that is very unpleasant to the ears.
Fit & Finish not as tight as BMW.
Row of switches on the centre console looks nice but not intuitive to use.
Off-Set steering makes you feel twisted while driving.
Uncomfortable seats that lack support and comfort on long drives.
Rough shifts from the 9G-Tronic gearbox
Harsh ride with no pliancy whatsoever, especially at high speed corners.

ReviewGood representation of Mercedes class design, both exterior and interior. Details are just exquisite. 

C180 similar to BMW 318 and A4 in terms of engine size to looks. Merely sufficient. C200 would be just nice. 

Smooth 9 gears transmission and only one with passenger memory seat in its class.

What I like1) Interior is just top notch Mercedes design, love the seats, the buttons, the steering wheels, the stitches...
2) Even comes with auto-park feature. 
3) Passenger Memory seat really pleases the other halve.
4) Good interior space for 5 adults.

What I do not like1) Need to rev very high to go quick for the 1.6L Turbo, very un-glam with the harsh exhaust note. 
2) AD model made in SA. Hmmm..  
3) Fake dual exhaust design is the largest turnoff, seriously? 
4) Tiny little iPad looking middle screen

ReviewOverall nice styling externally and internally although I must say that just like BMW, Merc's styling is getting a bit dated and need a desperate refreshing change.

As mentioned below, the RWD idea is not crucial IMO as the speed at which the roads here can cater to will hardly make much difference between RWD vs. FWD.
What I like-
What I do not like-

ReviewMy friend bought one and had the chance to sit in to experience. Went to view one C200 AMG at PI. Somehow different feel and different experience. Generally was impressed with PI C200 AMG with lots of features e.G. Heater seats & auto thigh extension for front seaters. C250 AMG bought by friend on the other hand was fully of complaints. Intrusive noise, bad customer service from authorized dealer, delivered different spec as showroom (with sports stitches vs without stitches), yaya papaya sale rep etc. In the end my friend had to fork out own money to do up extra noise insulation for 4 doors and ended up with minor scratches in the process of installation. 

To be fair I did not test drive this car but mandatory fields must be filled in so I rated "Average" For handling and engine performance.

What I like1. exterior design (front).
2. Comfortable interior.
3. Quiet interior for PI C200 AMG

What I do not like1. Exterior design (rear) is weird looking.
2. Rear leg room.
3. noisy engine is audible at front passenger seat (for C250 AMG from authorized dealer).
4. Long lead time for delivery (i.e. 5 months).
5. No GPS feature despite branded car at this price.
6. High technology features package not as competitive as BMW.
7. Arrogant (or lousy) customer service.

ReviewDrove my mum's car a few times. Felt that it is very comfortable and looks good. But at 190k, there are much better options available outside. First thing is when you spent so much money on a car, it should be at least German made not SA. The car was sent in a few times to adjust the brakes, suspension and Ecu that speaks about about the fitting quality of the SA. Engine don't feel as if it's 180bhp more like 122bhp, my sis 6 year old civic has a livelier engine.

What I like- Very comfortable
- good looks and styling.

What I do not like- Expensive
- Poor fitting quality
- Reliability is chap
-Complicated interior
